oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christopher Ammons's 1970 selective service card

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammonss1970 selective service card shows his name and signature on one side and physical description on the reverse. The classification of IV-A would have exempted him from service (for those whose military obligation was completed, or for only surviving sons of a family in which the father, or one or more sons or daughters, were killed or died in the line of duty while in the Armed Forces, or subsequently died as a result of such service).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Draft
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Draft -- United States -- History -- 20th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The U.S. Selective Service System is the agency that collects and maintains data on potential military conscription registrants. Most male U.S. citizens and male immigrant non-citizens between the ages of 18 and 25 are required by law to register within 30 days of their 18th birthday. Christopher Ammons enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, serving with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police.
